headline: Why Fortinet (FTNT) Is Down 8.1% After 2026 Guidance Upside and a Valuation-Driven Downgrade
summary: In early February 2026, Fortinet reported full-year 2025 results showing revenue of US$6,799.6 million and net income of US$1,853.4 million, alongside issuing 2026 revenue guidance of US$7.50 billion to US$7.70 billion and confirming completion of a long-running US$8.87 billion share buyback program. On the same day, Freedom Capital Markets downgraded Fortinet from Buy to Hold on valuation and competitive risk concerns, highlighting a tension between the company’s solid reported performance...

On the same day, Freedom Capital Markets downgraded Fortinet from Buy to Hold on valuation and competitive risk concerns, highlighting a tension between the company’s solid reported performance...
